page.title: 13Gliddons of Williton
page.content: Gliddons was a{blacksmith}before it became a{Garage. }J.Gliddon and his son bought the premises in Williton. They took on{four smiths } to deal with the trade. At the beginning of the century the Blacksmiths in the High Street had to make a bit more room for the{motor {car. }At first Benjamin Gliddon had conducted the motor business over at Bank Street near the School and the company sold Rustun and Hornsby Cars. These were such{difficult vehicles to} drive that one customer, Mr George Risdon, of Washford would travel all the way down to the station yard in order to avoid putting the machine in {reverse gear.} There was a dozen cars in the whole of Somerset. J.Gliddon and Sons jumped on the bandwagon by selling their{touring models at Â£125 in 1916 but at Â£230 four years later.
